intro: Rapanea dumbeaensis, commonly known as the Dumbleaena or Dumbleaena tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the island of Madagascar and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while the flowers are white or pale pink, often with a red calyx. Rapanea dumbeaensis is notable for its ecological importance in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various local fauna.
